definition: To separate oneself from an object or a person, typically by physically placing or leaving it in a designated location. This action is commonly associated with the completion of a task or the act of discarding or storing an item.

examples.german: Bitte legen Sie Ihre Waffen ab.
Er legt großen Wert auf Pünktlichkeit.
examples.english: He places great importance on punctuality.

examples.german: Sie legte ihre Hand auf seine Schulter.
examples.english: She placed her hand on his shoulder.

examples.german: Der Hund legt sich unter den Tisch.
examples.english: The dog lies down under the table.
